com.qweex.callisto

Class DatabaseConnector

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.qweex.callisto.DatabaseConnector

  • public class DatabaseConnector
extends java.lang.Object
    A tool for communicating with the SQlite database It has 3 different tables in it: episodes, queue, and calendar
    Author:
    MrQweex

        boolean isDown)
        [DATABASE_QUEUE] Moves an item either forward or back in the queue
        Parameters:
        id1 - The ID to move either forward or back
        isDown - True means direction is back, otherwise moves forward.

      • advanceQueue

        public Cursor advanceQueue(int forward)
        [DATABASE_QUEUE] Advances the marker for the current item of the queue and returns a cursor containing that item
        Parameters:
        forward - True moves it forward forward, false moves backward
        Returns:
        A Cursor containing the new current item

               java.lang.String type,
               java.lang.String date,
               java.lang.String time,
               int recurring)
        [DATABASE_CALENDAR] Inserts a new event. Parameters should be (mostly) self explanatory
        Parameters:
        recurring - 0 if the event is non-recurring, the day index otherwise (1-7 for Sun-Sat)

      • getOneEvent

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        A cursor containing the one event

      • dayEvents

        public Cursor dayEvents(java.lang.String specificDay,
               int dayOfWeek)
        Retrieves all events for a specific day
        Parameters:
        specificDay - the specific day (e.g. 20120123)
        dayOfWeek - The day....wait for it....of the week. 1-7 for Sun-Sat
        Returns:
        A Cursor containing all events for the specified day
